question: Peloton’s main products are Internet-connected stationary bikes and treadmills that enable subscribers to remotely participate in live classes via streaming media. This enables subscribers to have a “spin class” experience without going to the gym. On what basis has Peloton segmented the market?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Geographic segmentation divides a market according to geographic areas such as regions, cities, states, countries, etc.
That’s not correct. Behavioral segmentation is a method of grouping consumers by their behavior patterns.
That’s not correct. Demographic segmentation groups consumers by focusing on traits such as age, gender, income, etc.
Just like our in-text example of Mirror, Peloton speaks to the personality of people who want to work out but can’t find the time to go to the gym.

detailedSolution: Just like our in-text example of Mirror, Peloton speaks to the personality of people who want to work out but can’t find the time to go to the gym.
